description:
If you or a loved one has been seriously injured in an accident due to someone's negligence, it is important to reach out to skilled counsel who can protect your rights and do everything to obtain the compensation you need to fully recover and heal.

Based in Columbus, we at the law firm of Geiser, Bowman & McLafferty, LLC, are dedicated to helping victims of accidents throughout the state of Ohio. While an accident by itself can be extremely traumatizing, many people are dismayed by the delays, denials and foot-dragging by insurance companies, sometimes from their own insurance carriers. We are here to help. Our attorneys each have more than two decades of experience and are prepared to work on cases involving:

  • Car accidents
  • Truck accidents
  • Motorcycle accidents
  • Pedestrian accidents
  • Wrongful Death
  • Brain Injuries
  • Medical malpractice
  • Cyclist accidents
  • Premises liability

Regardless of your circumstances, our personal injury attorneys will do everything to obtain compensation for:

  • Lost wages
  • Medical bills
  • Property damage
  • Loss of life's joys
  • Unforeseen costs

We have free parking a block from the courthouse and are prepared to make home, hospital and other off-site visits, as well as evening and weekend meetings by appointment. We work on all personal injury cases on contingency — we will never collect any fees unless we obtain the compensation you need.

Our attorneys at Geiser, Bowman & McLafferty, LLC, have distinguished themselves within the legal community. Attorneys on our staff have gained professional recognition, including membership in the Million Dollar Advocates Forum, certification by the National Board of Trial Advocacy, designation as a Super Lawyer by Cincinnati monthly and induction into the Ohio Academy of Trial Lawyers Trial College Hall of Fame.

Other accolades include Top 100 Trial Lawyers, Super Lawyers, Ohio Association for Justice, American Association for Justice and COAJ. Additionally, we are licensed to practice before the Supreme Court.
